intro: Horkelia californica subsp. frondosa, commonly known as the frondose horkelia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its basal rosette of lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces blue to purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal and inland mountainous regions. Horkelia californica subsp. frondosa is adapted to full sun and is drought-tolerant once established.
